intro: Simira ignicola, commonly known as the fire-bearer tree, is a tropical plant native to parts of South America. It is a flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae, known for its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are often visited by birds and insects, contributing to its role in local ecosystems. The plant's name, "ignicola," refers to its association with fire, possibly due to its role in fire-prone habitats.
